Homeless.

While all the other options may have their own unique challenges and struggles, being homeless adds an additional layer of complexity to the patient's situation. Homeless individuals often face significant barriers to accessing healthcare, including lack of transportation, limited access to showers and clean clothes, and difficulty navigating complex healthcare systems.
